oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Roy Acuff Grand Ole Opry Discs: Tape 10
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of Roy Acuff's Prince Albert sponsored Grand Ole Opry. The recording features multiple recordings. The tape features: the Old Hickory Singers (musical group), Redy Foley (musician), Roy Acuff (musician), the Smokey Mountain Boys (musical group), Grandpa Jones (musician), Rod Brasfield (comedian), Tommy Jackson (musican), Oswald (musician), and Jimmie Riddle (musician). The tape is labeled Acuff's tape number ten of an unidentified number. The multiple recordings are from November 01, 1947.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Old Hickory Singers; Red Foley; Roy Acuff; Smokey Mountain Boys; Grandpa Jones; Rod Brasfield; Tommy Jackson; Oswald; Jimmie Riddle
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:08) Red Foley introduces Roy Acuff -- (00:44) Little Moses (Roy Acuff and the Smokey Mountain Band) -- (03:12) Acuff introduces Minnie Pearl -- (03:37) Uncloudy Day (Roy Acuff and the Smokey Mountain Band) -- (06:21) Get Things Ready for Me Maw, 'Cause I'm Coming Home (Grandpa Jones) -- (07:57) Rod Brasfield performs a comedy routine -- (11:04) Minnie Pearl performs an American Ace Coffee Commercial Spot -- (11:33) Opening Theme [featuring voiceover] (Roy Acuff and the Smokey Mountain Band) -- (11:55) Louie Buck performs a commercial spot -- (12:21) Live and Let Live [skips] (Roy Acuff and the Smokey Mountain Band) -- (15:11) Turkey in the Straw (Tommy Jackson) -- (16:28) Buck performs a commercial spot -- (18:19) Nobody's Business (Brother Oswald) -- (20:15) Acuff reads off the poem: ""Working on the Farm"" -- (23:00) Buck performs a commercial spot -- (24:19) Ida Red (Roy Acuff) -- (25:11) My Old Pal of Yesterday (Roy Acuff and the Smokey Mountain Band) -- (29:12) Sow Song (Jimmie Riddle)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Old Hickory Singers; Foley, Red, 1910-1968; Acuff, Roy; Smoky Mountain Boys; Jones, Grandpa, 1913-1998; Brasfield, Rod; Brasfield, Rod, 1910-1958; Jackson, Tommy; Brother Oswald; Riddle, Jimmy, 1918-1982;
